required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Cervical Cancer Screening Project Part C
clinical_study.official_title: Minnesota Community Networks Center for Eliminating Cancer Disparities: Cervical Cancer Screening Project Part C Quantitative

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

clinical_study.source: University of Minnesota - Clinical and Translational Science Institute

brief_summary.textblock: This proposal has been developed through collaboration between the University of Minnesota and New American Community Services (NACS), and the research design is based on a needs assessment conducted by the community partner. The investigators will test the hypotheses that women who are offered home vaginal bio-specimen collection will have higher rate of cervical cancer screening completion than that of women referred for clinic-based Pap test. All participants will be given identical education materials on cervical cancer screening and HPV, currently in use by the Minnesota Sage Program.

detailed_description.textblock: The trial will pilot text a protocol for home vaginal bio-specimen collection for human papillomavirus (HPV) testing for cervical cancer screening. The main objective is to estimate the successful screening completion rate among a sample of Somali women who have not undergone cervical cancer screening for three or more years. Women will be randomized to either home vaginal bio-specimen collection or referral to undergo a clinic-based Pap test.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Investigator left University No results are possible

primary_outcome.measure: Number of home vaginal bio-specimen collections compared to standard clinic-based Pap test
primary_outcome.description: The main outcome will be successful completion of cervical cancer screening by 3 months after enrollment. For the Home Vaginal Biospecimen Collection Group, completion is defined as return of the HPV DNA self-sampling kit by the patient, with a sample suitable for laboratory analysis. In the Clinic Pap Test Group, completion is defined by documentation of Pap test result.

arm_group.description: Somali women who are randomized for Home based Vaginal Collection will be given a kit to perform the vaginal sample collection for HPV analysis, with detailed written instructions.

30 Somali women who are randomized for Standard Clinic Pap Group will be given a list of clinics that they can attend for cervical cancer screening using pap test. Follow-up will be done on test completion with the clinic at 3 months after enrollment.

biospec_descr.textblock: Home based or clinic based HPV test (Pap) collection

study_pop.textblock: Somali female - Participants may speak Somali or English as their primary language.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Somali female age 25-70 years
- have lived in the U.S. 10 years or less
- have not had a Pap test (by self report) in the last 3 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- Women with a self reported past history of any of the following will not be eligible:
- total hysterectomy
- cervical cancer
- active history of cervical dysplasia

overall_official.affiliation: Masonic Cancer Center, University of Minnesota

facility.name: Masonic Cancer Center, University of Minnesota
